Text: Lakeside and Marblehead Railroad:  It extended from Marblehead through Lakeside to a connection with the Lake Shore and Michigan Southern Railway (later the New York Central Railroad) at Danbury (an unincorporated hamlet bordering Sandusky Bay).
Triplets:<Lakeside and Marblehead Railroad
Lake Shore and Michigan Southern Railway
3:
--------------------
Text: Lakeside and Marblehead Railroad:  It was abandoned as a common carrier railroad July 31, 1964, operated for the last time as a private industrial railroad in Summer 1978, and its tracks were removed in Fall 1997.
Triplets:<Lakeside and Marblehead Railroad
